headline: Walgreens To Expand Use Of Prescription-Filling Robots, Cites $500 Million In Savings As Motive
summary: Walgreens has plans to expand its use of robot-powered micro-fulfillment centers The centers currently serve 4,800 stores, and fill more than 16 million prescriptions each month The push for automation comes as Walgreens prepares to go private in a deal with Sycamore Partners Walgreens will be expanding its use of prescription-filling robots, CNBC reports. The pharmacy chain began using micro-fulfillment centers in 2021 before pausing the program in 2023 to focus on feedback and improvement. Now
